If I use the pWing as a panel it forces the aerodynamic forces to the inside and not down the piece like a normal wing. Thanks love your designs.

Yes! edit the cfgs and change drag and lift to 0, this will alleviate your problem somewhat however any angled pwing u use is  drag inducing.  imo the best way to use these is this: use rather op engines (kspie or tweakscaled stuff), use a counterweight at the front of the craft, u will need this for autostruts to latch on and will enable you to play with the geometry more since the more detailed your pwing based cockpits are the more the <abbr title="Center of Lift">COL</abbr> will move to the front. Also double your control surfaces (place them one on top of each other) this will help alot with control when operating your pwing craft.  Add nose cones inside of your craft this will certainly reduce some of the drag, fairings work even better but are difficult to use i had success with Procedural Parts nose cones as well. Keep in mind symmetry is very important if u leave a wing/panel angled u have to compensate for that with a pwing angled in the opposite direction or u will end up with huge aero issues such as ur crafts having a clear tendency to nose down or up. Another important thing, sometimes, some pwings crafts will promptly explode on the runway, if they do it is worth reverting to launch sometimes that fixes it.
